name: places/ChIJpWLW2CX2wokR_tQVTsXJoio
adrFormatAddress: 2658 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Corner storefront offering hand-rolled bagels, pancakes & specialty sandwiches morning to night.

originalText.text:
Good place to grab a Bagel in the way to Central Park. Place is very crowded, which is mostly a good sign. Ordering is a little bit chaotic and not well organised.
Unfortunately no place to eat or to sit down.
Bagel are delicious, but the price is also very high.
Definitely worth to visit.

text.text:
Good place to grab a Bagel in the way to Central Park. Place is very crowded, which is mostly a good sign. Ordering is a little bit chaotic and not well organised.
Unfortunately no place to eat or to sit down.
Bagel are delicious, but the price is also very high.
Definitely worth to visit.

originalText.text:
I'm staying with friends, so am not a regular here, but did grow up in Manhattan on a healthy diet of everything bagels and cream cheese. Came in to pick up bagels for the family- 2 everything, 2 plain, 2 cinnamon raisin. I got home to discover that I didn't get everything's and got sesame instead. A definite downgrade, but I could still assess the bagels. They are big and don't look like they'd be very good, but at 7am they are still warm from the oven and the dough has an outstanding chew. It's good enough that you can really enjoy the bagel without any cream cheese.

I also picked up a container of lox spread and green onion spread. The lox spread doesn't taste super fresh, but the green onion one really pops.

All in all happy with the purchases and will definitely be back. A good option if the line at Absolute Bagel is nuts.

originalText.text: okay I used to be a loyal H&H customer but decided to try out this place bc it's cheaper on grubhub and... this place slaps. the everything bagel actually has salt on it!! very fluffy bagel. the cream cheese at H&H is still better but the scallions in the scallion cream cheese here are way fresher and there's more of them. 10/10

text.text: okay I used to be a loyal H&H customer but decided to try out this place bc it's cheaper on grubhub and... this place slaps. the everything bagel actually has salt on it!! very fluffy bagel. the cream cheese at H&H is still better but the scallions in the scallion cream cheese here are way fresher and there's more of them. 10/10

originalText.text: We've been to Broadway Bagel a couple of times, it's one of our go-to bagel spots in the city. We ordered a couple of sandwiches there. Such as their Ruben on every Bagel, which was juicy, they don't skimp on "the everything" on the bagel, the cheesy was melty and gooey when you open the sandwich, and overall tasty. We also got their Pesto Chicken on an Everything Bagel too. The pesto tasted fresh and you taste the basil on it, the chicken was nicely seasoned. Of course, we ordered a normal Everything Bagel with Scallion cream cheese. They have a wide variety of cream cheese to choose from but the scallion is refreshing.  We love getting our bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel as well so we got one and it was delicious! The bacon was crispy, and the egg as well done with the melted American cheese. They made it good!

text.text: We've been to Broadway Bagel a couple of times, it's one of our go-to bagel spots in the city. We ordered a couple of sandwiches there. Such as their Ruben on every Bagel, which was juicy, they don't skimp on "the everything" on the bagel, the cheesy was melty and gooey when you open the sandwich, and overall tasty. We also got their Pesto Chicken on an Everything Bagel too. The pesto tasted fresh and you taste the basil on it, the chicken was nicely seasoned. Of course, we ordered a normal Everything Bagel with Scallion cream cheese. They have a wide variety of cream cheese to choose from but the scallion is refreshing.  We love getting our bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel as well so we got one and it was delicious! The bacon was crispy, and the egg as well done with the melted American cheese. They made it good!

originalText.text: Stopped in for breakfast for the first time before a morning walk to Central Park and onto the Met. The place was busy ( a good sign!) and the service brisk and friendly. Hubby got the nova lox with scallion cream cheese, capers, onion and tomatoes on an everything bagel as other reviewers suggested and it was amazing! The rest of us had very tasty everything bagel egg sandwiches which were also excellent. We had read about the unique French toast bagel and even though our portions were large, had one to share and it was just enough maple-y sweetness and not overwhelming sweet at all. I hoped to get back before our trip ended to try one toasted with butter and sweetened cream cheese —I think that would be fantastic! Time didn’t allow us to return but next visit will do for sure. Even just the regular coffee was well brewed and perfect boldness. We met the owner too, impressed with his diligent management of the place and had a very welcoming and friendly conversation—his care and attention to everything is impressive. Overall great food and service and a well cared for establishment.
